website_summaries.verdict: With adjustable leg mounts, this professional-style tripod dolly will meet the needs of even the most demanding videographer.
pros: Wheels are designed so they move smoothly on all surfaces
They also roll smoothly to make shooting high-quality video on the move an easy process
Components are durable, yet the price is affordable
cons: May not accommodate certain models and sizes of tripods

customer_reviews.title: Needs oil
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit, but used it a couple of times before oiling the castors. I found the wheels resistant to smooth rolling on a wood floor. They work better with oil, but still not as well as I'd like. It still has some jerkiness if I move the tripod on the dolly while shooting video—which is the main reason I bought this dolly. In every other way, it is more than adequate for my needs (shooting seminar speakers). If the Chinese would oil the wheels before shipping, I think customers would be a little happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jens Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy but a bit of a pain to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have had my dolica for several years now and often use it in my studio and especially on LOCATION! This really helps the quality of my work and my back too. I also attach my surface to my tripod in order to work tethered even outdoors, really great help! The only complaint is that the tabs to attach the tripod could be a bit bigger thus allowing for a better grip... Plus it makes composing on the fly really easy!
customer_reviews.author: Pro

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for What it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for both still and video photography and it works well with my larger tripod. For still shots, this helps in positioning the camera to various areas with ease. For video, it does move the camera around and I'm only using an amature video camera with the image stabilization on. That said, it does shake and rattle the image over cement and areas that are not perfect. On stage or gym floors, it's fine. Again, I'm not spending $500 for a dampened tripod dolly but this works well for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Blee1Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high-quality, easy to assemble and use tripod cart. These cards are really great when you are simply rolling between shots with a heavy rig. first-time owners should be aware that there is no shock absorption in the tripod wheels. Every bump or tile-edge that you roll over will be transmitted directly to the camera. a cart like this will not provide you with smooth sweeping shots unless you have amazing image stabilization built into your camera or lens.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good dolly for the price. Solid build. All latches, docks tighten well and hold. I sometimes see reviews of this and similar dollys where people are trying to use them as "trollys" for video shots. Good luck. Some have even smaller wheels. This has 3" wheels. Tripods attach very solidly, making the tripod and dolly *one unit.* Very convenient to *roll* your equipment 12' "that way" when doing a shoot, than pick it up and schlep. Chances are this (and other similar) tripod will prevent your tripod from opening to IT's widest "door-opening width" which *does* affect center-of-gravity-- but I doubt many use 500mm telephotos that might tip it in the "studio." (or your den)
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and wheels do not rotate easily
customer_reviews.text: I preface my review by saying that I purchased this product used from Amazon Warehouse and it arrived broken; a wheel was broken off and the thin aluminum frame holding the wheel in place was broken too. So read this negative review with that in mind. I hastily repaired with as best as I could with tape but after the wheels would not rotate freely. The brake on the wheel kept making contact with the thumb screw to adjust how far from the center the tripod leg locks would slide. It made for a terrible performance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Portable, light, and easy to set-up
customer_reviews.text: The dolly worked very well for the work that my local Indy Film Meetup needed it for. It is portable (two of the legs fold back on the third) and fits in a shoulder carry satchel. It is light, less than 15 lbs (7 kilos). It is easy to fit to your existing tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Reasonable Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, but doesn't work well on most surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this dolly, I knew I wasn't getting a very high quality product, but at the price I was excited to try it and figured it would do the job for some simple shoots indoors on hardwood. Unfortunately it struggles to stay smooth even on only slightly rough surfaces. We were shooting on a worn plywood floor and the wheels could barely move without issues. It works okay on very smooth floors but for anything else you might as well hand hold your camera. I'm hoping with some adjustments we can get the wheels to roll more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: Light use - NOT PRO LEVEL at this price I should have known
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived! NICE WHEELS/CASTERS - rubber wheels - I LOVED the instant look. Extending the arms to a tiny sping pin wasn't impressive and the leg locking clamps are plastic. Well it was cheap. So I figured I got what I paid for. But didn't fit my pro tripod even when the legs are at the lowest level. So impossible for my to use. Luckily - I LOVE AMAZON - they'll pick it up and I'll order a better one. $$$$ = (
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Good for light weight camera work.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this was a good trolly, simple to set and light to carry or move. If you are shooting movies at home or in the street without the aid of tracks and heavy cameras, this is good for a dslr like a Cannon or Nikon. Rolled very smoothly on laminate floors and carpeting. This will bend and even break if you lean heavily on it. It is designed to be moved on the wheels with gentle pushes.
customer_reviews.author: RAK

customer_reviews.title: great product, just wish it lasted more than a handful of uses
customer_reviews.text: i used this for when i was recording video. when it worked, it worked great. the dolly gave me a very smooth transition when moving the camera around. the only issue i have is after a handful of uses, maybe 6, the button that collapses the dolly broke. it is still usable, but will no longer collapse without the use of a screwdriver or something to depress the button.
customer_reviews.author: Hale Googlezon

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. I just keep my tripod permanently mounted in it. It mostly just makes it real easy to move the tripod around. I do videos. I have not used it in a pan yet, but in order for it to work, the floor would have to be exceedingly smooth. It is very solidly constructed and easy to fold away for when not it use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: OK on a budget
customer_reviews.text: It works, but the spread may be too small so if you stand your tripod too high it might fall easily especially on carpet. It would only help to move your setup if you can't easily hold it up, other than that it has no other use like a dolly shot or something because it's not stable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: great - light with a bag
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use it last month. I carry 3 tripods and the one I bought this device for is an old 5 by 7 tripod. The dolly is adjustable and clamps to the tripod legs well. I did enjoy using it but it will take me a little time to get used to not doing handheld photography. I would recommend this product for still or motion photography (on a relatively smooth surface).
customer_reviews.author: fern

customer_reviews.title: This is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: So nice to be able to just move the camera out of the way with having to adjust angle and zoom, ect. then just roll back into place when needed. The quality is great ...I wont say heavy duty... but its solid
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Handy & Compact. Play w/ Movement
customer_reviews.text: Very cool, and as long as you're on smooth concrete or hard flooring that doesn't create sound, I've even used it to move the camera shot. You have to watch doing that though as it has those shopping cart wheels that want to turn in weird ways. Using it as far as what it's supposed to be used for, I can say it works great for moving the sticks between shots, especially when I don't forget to lock the wheels every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramiah J BoltonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Too small for most stands and tripods
customer_reviews.text: This thing is too small- maybe I should have read the dimensions a little more closely, but honestly, this really can't fit ANY of my stands in my studio, and maybe ONE tripod, if I don't spread the legs out very much...
customer_reviews.author: wasuck

customer_reviews.title: Practical and portable solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very practical and portable tool. It essential lyturns any tripod into a dolly. It folds and unfolds easily and is easy to transport. It's pretty durable and the wheels roll well on many different surfaces, though you will see the initial pull when you start movement..,especially turns/swivels. The only issue is sometimes the tripod legs pop out of the vice but it says it fits ALMOST any tripod so that's to be expected. It's certainly a steal for the price. I've purchased two!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Not for C stands
customer_reviews.text: I had to return them even though they were well made. Unfortunately they do not work with C stands. I just figured I'd leave this as a review for those who are trying to do what I was trying to do
customer_reviews.author: Hellenic

customer_reviews.title: Great for the task at hand
customer_reviews.text: Added this to the camera stand and we now have some smooth mobility. Its a nice extra for our church family. Moves fluidly and for a fair price Fit was not exact but made it work
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Burke

customer_reviews.title: Fits many sizes of tripods.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and useful - however, in moving across indoor outdoor carpet (very low nap) in the studio, it causes a jiggling movement in the video. Useful then on concrete or hard floor only. Wheels would work better with more built-in resilience or flexibility, better able to run over slightly textured surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Reader

customer_reviews.title: Smooth wheels when rolling and its not cheaply made like other bullSh
customer_reviews.text: You wont regret getting this. Smooth wheels when rolling and its not cheaply made like other bullSh!t stuff from China
customer_reviews.author: huong nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I used it for filming some short films. The wheels never stuck or anything. I think it basically fits and tripod legs. Very durable and a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, hard to execute.
customer_reviews.text: The wheels buck around alot and cause a lot of unsteady shots i think if you can maybe make a track to go with it, it could deff help. For the price it's good, but expect to do tons of retakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jamyle

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod dolly with locking wheels
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great tripod dolly with locking wheels. Easy to use. Not for the high end tripods that require the rubber pull over attachments at each leg. Works well with my straight tip tripod legs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and fast set-up
customer_reviews.text: Grips tripod legs well and rolls very well; however, if tripod legs are not placed towards the outer perimeter of the legs this will sag and Appears it would break with little pressure applied.
customer_reviews.author: UptownFoto

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory to have!
customer_reviews.text: Working part time commercially for 45 years, I've always had an industrial dolly in studio. but as I'm getting older, I wanted to have one for location work as it's getting harder to lug a Bogen 3042 around. This was a great inexpensive sturdy, very portable option to add to by gear box. Why did I wait so long to pick one up?
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifully, very smooth bearings
customer_reviews.text: If you are into videography and don't have a big movie budget, this is the item for you. Very easy to mount any current tri-pod you have to it and off you go. I recently shot a commercial for a local private school and used this a lot for all aspects of the shooting process. Love it so much I plan on purchasing a few more for second camera and lights on tri-pods for better video shooting.
customer_reviews.author: RKWarner

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Tripod Dolly
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised how sturdy this dolly is. The wheels are large on heavy duty casters. Everything is great quality, but I wouldn’t say its light weight tho. I don’t need to carry my tripod so the weight isn’t an issue for me. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Big MaBear

customer_reviews.title: Great wheels!!
customer_reviews.text: Great when used with my tripod and production camera. Handles weight well. Have only used indoors on carpet and bare floors. Smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: About the only thing I can fault so far is the wheels, it would benefit from larger, softer wheels for using as a camera dolly to smooth things out
customer_reviews.author: Skyowa LLC

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Saves time.
customer_reviews.text: These wheels are super portable, and set up fast. Makes adjustment...moving video camera tripod much easier, and even smooth enough to use for doing a dolly shot if you have a smooth floor surface and work with it a but. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: David Thiessen

customer_reviews.title: Holds and rolls like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my tripod that has a teleprompter and Canon T6i attached to it. Rolls great on finished concrete and low nap carpet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Basic, durable, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and found it to be everything I expected and so bought a second one. No complaints from me. I have even used it as a slider when the tripod was on a smooth flat surface with success.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Greaves, audio engineer, professor

customer_reviews.title: For the same price as a mini dolly, get this instead!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the mini dolly for my DSLR camera for shooting smooth panning videos - when i happen to find this gem. I was able to get the same smoothness by mounting my tripod on this dolly. I moves pretty smooth on carpet (not those thick carpet though). I can also bring this dolly to trade shows and shoot video too - all for the same cost as those mini table dollies!
customer_reviews.author: Too Nerdy Tech

customer_reviews.title: like it, just what I need
customer_reviews.text: wide though, takes up a lot of space, but rolling is soft and smooth when going slow.
customer_reviews.author: Dede

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I remember when tripod dollies were expensive. I took a chance on this and didn't really expect much. I'm genuinely astonished that this thing is every bit the quality the expensive ones used to be.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well on flat ground and does what it's suppose to do, it's also light and portable
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Martinez

customer_reviews.title: I laid a cardboard on the ground and it seemed to help a bit but it's not perfect. The construction of the dolly is very well ..
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect fluid video when using this dolly. Since the wheels are on casters if you change a direction the casters will catch and spin making it noticeable in the video. I laid a cardboard on the ground and it seemed to help a bit but it's not perfect. The construction of the dolly is very well made. It is very durable however I returned mine due to it being unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: great dolly for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod dolly! Yes it is not as heavy duty as some of the others but it is light and very functional. Rolls great on smooth concrete areas, if you want or need to change out the wheels you can with a little know how. I use this with both my Ravelli AVTP Tripods with attached rigs with no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nightmarcher

customer_reviews.title: A great platform to build
customer_reviews.text: Smooth rolling....I mean WOW!, this base moves smoothly! Solidly built, but lightweight and quiet. Wheels are durable. Wheel locks tight. A great platform to build on
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great dolly, wheels a big and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: The wheel locking system works well, there is a great system for adjusting to different tripod dimensions. comes with a bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Camera Dolly
customer_reviews.text: this is perfect for moving my camera around while filming
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene H

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose Tripod Dolly
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these dollies. They support speaker tripods with either large monitor speakers or heavy multimedia projectors. They are wonderful. Roll extremely smooth with very little effort, the wheels lock easily, and they were easy to adjust and use without any modifications. I will probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got these to shoot a rap video (which unfortunately didn't pan out as the lead vocalist ended up getting thrown in jai before we could finish production) and they seem to be of very good, strong construction. My only misgiving is that they do not extend out, but instead have a sliding clamp on each leg. As a result the dolly is always the same size which can cause problems in tight locations. Other than that it appears to be a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Foster

customer_reviews.title: Everything should be on wheels
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to use. I have three of these and they work great. I have two Manfrotto light stands and a Manfrotto tripod on them to good effect; makes moving everything around in my small studio much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful dolly to have around my work area. My main tripod (which happens to be a Dolica) fits on it perfectly. I am sure most other tripods would work great as well. It's well-built, sturdy, and the wheels stay locked-up well when needed. For the money, you can't find a better deal. I am very pleased with the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: Only wish the wheels moved around a little more fluidly/smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kinmartin

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for laptop station when shooting tethered in the studio!
customer_reviews.text: Build quality for the price is really good with this set. I often shoot tethered in the studio so I have afor my laptop with these wheels attached to the base so I can easily roll my workstation around the studio as-needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wheels on a tripod makes filmmaking easy!
customer_reviews.text: Putting a wheel base on a tripod makes filming scenes so easy! Boring static shots don't engage with the viewer especially in the film I was making. This product delivered the ease I was expecting and it took like a minute to setup. The instructions that were provided were almost unnecessary. Will use every chance I get from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jose de Jesus Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product construction and quality it has not only impressed many but it is an attention grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got my dolly a few days after ordering. I am happy with the quality. It is bigger than I expected. It rolls great the wheels don't get stuck. The locking mechanism is very easy to control. Much better than my other dolly. You don't have to reach down and press it with your hand. Thank you very much I am please with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: elza balian

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the price
customer_reviews.text: As an aspiring film Cinematographer, I was looking for equipment that was affordable and suitable. When I unboxed the item and used it I was very amazed. For the price, it does what it's supposed to do anything very easy to set up as well to carry. It was also delivered to me in a timely fashion. I also adore how easy it is to adjust the wheels so that my tripod can fit no matter what the size or how far apart the legs are spread. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Get This
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I buy this long ago? It has made my life so much easier. Now I just mount my camera on my tripod, then the tripod on this and I am scooting around on the inside of my real estate listings shooting stills and HD video much easier than using a gimbal and far cheaper. Great Product, smooth like a dolly now.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Harrold

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed in the construction. The description only mentions that it is made of Metal and Rubber. The central hub that holds everything together is made of plastic. Also the clamps are plastic. It all works but you cant really use a lot of weight on the arms as they will bend from the center hub.
customer_reviews.author: Jimography

customer_reviews.title: Solid.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy! Do yourself a favor and buy one.
customer_reviews.author: britpop

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: The dolly is heavier-duty than I expected for this price. It rolls smoothly and handles easily. Good product. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: MBGTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Almost good
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this to be a good product. But wheel has to be bigger. Moving around creates micro jitters, that can not be removed in post production. Will have to return it. Product as a whole is as advertised, strong.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this dolly to use for video, but to be honest it’s so much better for taking photos. I used to have to move my tripod around so much when I was doing school photos, executive headshots, etc. Now this makes my job so much easier. Best thing I’ve purchased for photography in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Velez

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Need some sort of support in the middle of the trally.from behind ing down like a 5will support
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerlyon

customer_reviews.title: Impressed and very happy! Helps so much at large events
customer_reviews.text: Extremely helpful at large events/venues, really takes the strain off of working those types of gigs. Works absolutely perfect on smooth surfaces, which can help get some incredible shots, but also durable on rough surfaces. No issues with wheels or locks, my Manfrotto 507 tripod fits very well. I usually have a mini Jib attached as well.
customer_reviews.author: Axxeron

customer_reviews.title: Ease to use.
customer_reviews.text: The product met my expectations: easy to install, easy to store, large wheels to make it easy to move on carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Spontin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and well made
customer_reviews.text: Love love the convenience to move everything easy. Very well made
customer_reviews.author: Xoxo

customer_reviews.title: Wheel brake tabs on the caster constantly get caught on ...
customer_reviews.text: Wheel brake tabs on the caster constantly get caught on the rails and stop the wheels from turning a full 360. I've been in the middle of running countless rolling pans and have a large number of them ruined by this one simple design problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: it's a great add on and must-have for a tripod and anyone ...
customer_reviews.text: While it doesn't glide smoothly on all surfaces (which I expected), it's a great add on and must-have for a tripod and anyone who is constantly on the move with either a camera or video camera. The price wasn't too bad either. Pretty content. It also comes with a light-weight travel bag. Putting the brakes on this thing though is a little troublesome at times. It could just be that mine is wound too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Philippe Roche

customer_reviews.title: Excelent ptroduct, takes a little bit of time to ...
customer_reviews.text: Excelent ptroduct, takes a little bit of time to tighten the knobs for the tripod but it is to be expected, not a big deal, wheels locking mechanism works great as well. Slow movements produce great shots. Will definitely recommend it and hopefully get another one for my second camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dvdqrz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how professional this dolly looked. It is everything the description says. I really like the canvas bag to carry it in that is very light to carry over the shoulder. I love it for shooting video from my ipad or camorder. I recommend this dolly a thousand times over.
customer_reviews.author: MoxieGirl

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving camera equipment easy to move from one area to another with ease
customer_reviews.text: Makes moving camera equipment easy to move from one area to another with ease. A strong frame with an easy attachment for your tripod legs. This is a must for serious video or photo equipment handling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and fast to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: Had some of these but these are better. The leg holders are adjustible so it doesn't matter how close in you bring the legs of your tripod. Rolls smooth, wheels lock, very adjustable. And it's compact and fast to set up.
customer_reviews.author: james l linsley

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth and super easy to use. On very smooth surfaces it is almost unnoticeable and very fluid.
customer_reviews.author: gmoney

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this piece! Couldn't be simpler to operate. It's logical an intuitive in it's design and setup, folds down beautifully, and the rolling action is great. Will be using this mainly for my studio lights, but could even see use as a camera dolly under the right circumstances. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: Nice rolling tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rolling tripod and it did the trick for me. I mounted my camera tripod on it to take a video of an 80ft long hallway mural that I painted.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Myers

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dolly I have to say. Overall, the dolly is really smooth on smooth surfaces, such as wood floors or anything of the sort. However, when I use it on carpet, there is a somewhat noticeable shake in the footage when I have to move it around. Apart from that, its a great dolly if you plan to use it on smooth surfaces in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice to have larger wheels to make it easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well. Would be nice to have larger wheels to make it easier to move when my tripod has the extra weight of a small crane.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoJim

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these thinking they would work on C-Stands... they seemed to be great quality and work well on the cheaper tripod stands however I returned them since I only needed the for my C-Stands, but would buy them again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: JazzmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use, and the carrying bag makes it easy to carry. I will be buying another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: villip gatlin

customer_reviews.title: Quality dolly
customer_reviews.text: I’m very impressed with the quality of the dolly. The price is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D.J. Butler

customer_reviews.title: i just feel like its going to break at any time but
customer_reviews.text: its ok for the price, i just feel like its going to break at any time but hasn't
customer_reviews.author: Joan Ramos

customer_reviews.title: A must for Video
customer_reviews.text: Nice dolly! Great for tracking. Takes some practice but I love it. The plastic locks for the tripod are not a problem. You do not have to crank them down. It locks tight with a twist.
customer_reviews.author: Fatcat71

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this dolly. It's very strong and well made. No signs of cheap parts. It rolls smoothly even on a heavily carpeted floor.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Great product, awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to assemble and store. Although it is light, it is very sturdy and holds tripod with camera very well. Moves with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected and needed. in case you're wondering, this will fit any tripod, as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Fair.
customer_reviews.text: It's fair at best. At $30 you get what you pay for. Even on smooth surfaces, you will have shake. Bottom line: If you are using the dolly for recording video on the move, this is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: With love by Ash

customer_reviews.title: It also adds a nice height bump for my short tripods and the wheel ...
customer_reviews.text: This truck it absolutely a must have, especially for the price. I will be using this for all of my lightweight work. It also adds a nice height bump for my short tripods and the wheel locks are rock solid. If you need a truck for a lightweight setup, don't wait a second longer.
customer_reviews.author: Waschill

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm perhaps a sturdier one is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The base seens abit flimsy. Wheels ok not smooth. Adequate for my needs 4 functions a years. Curious how this worka outside?
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Caldea

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good buy. Very convenient to have because you don't have to lift your tripod with your camera attached when moving to another set. It saves time, hassle, and saves your camera from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Teknoray

customer_reviews.title: This works great! It attached seamlessly to my tripod
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It attached seamlessly to my tripod, and it rolls very smoothly! As long as the surface you are rolling it on is smooth, this thing works wonders for dollying your camera while capturing video!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this dolly
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this dolly, it's not heavy duty as my other dolly, but it does roll smooth and it's lite weight. It's just a matter of the right tool for the right job!
customer_reviews.author: Ricarzo S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, somewhat delimited applicability.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, limited application. I wanted this dolly for my light stand, but the grasping mechanisms work well only for my tripods. Otherwise, I appreciate this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas Porter

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, only issue is you need a supreme flat surface to reduce camera shake, but that is not the fault of this item. This is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: War Machine

customer_reviews.title: Great just watch the bags
customer_reviews.text: I would have gave full stars the the zipper on the bag was not working I might have to break the zipper to open the bad. Over all great. Will not hold really heavy cameras so use for small, to medium size canera and tripods. Looks great folds great.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Allen Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, good utility.
customer_reviews.text: This is a larger version of the table top size roller caster I bought. It's solidly built and hold and transports my tripod on smooth rolling wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Director

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality tripod dolly and at an excellent price. This is great since I am working with a tight budget. The dolly is very simply to set up and use. It rolls incredibly smooth, even on carpet (at least my carpet). The build is very durable feeling and should last me quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper & Debby Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: Used it at an Expo Event. It was such a life saver to move around with. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! I put all of my tripods and light stands in these and love the ease of moving my lights and camera around now!
customer_reviews.author: KATHRYN E MASSEY

customer_reviews.title: Item was a gift. Item was shipped on time ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was a gift. Item was shipped on time and I felt fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Travers

customer_reviews.title: ... of these a few weeks ago and they are awesome! Thanks for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these a few weeks ago and they are awesome! Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: RENDAL G RUTLEDGE

customer_reviews.title: This dolly exceeds the price!!
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is perfect for either professional or personal movie making, I do both. It is very adjustable to work with any tripod. Is decently heavy which improves overall performance leaving a smooth run. One of the best values I have bought for my movie making arsenal :)
customer_reviews.author: Vinceo66

customer_reviews.title: Glides smooth
customer_reviews.text: I love my tripod. Takes the weight off my hands, frees me to interact with the subject and lighting quickly but it can be slow to move and readjust. This clever dolly changes that. I can now zoom a prime and scoot around effortlessly. The fold up portability is great!
customer_reviews.author: L. Russell

customer_reviews.title: These seem well built and sturdy. We used one set for an entire month ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pair as I often shoot with two cameras. These seem well built and sturdy. We used one set for an entire month of shooting. No issues. Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: G. Adams

product_meta.title: Dolica LT-D100 Professional Lightweight and Heavy Duty Tripod Dolly with Adjustable Leg Mounts,Black
product_meta.description:
The Dolica LT-D100 is professional lightweight and heavy duty tripod dolly with adjustable leg mounts and wheel locks. The one step lock, locks the wheels easily and Non Marring wheels move smoothly on any hard surface. The tripod dolly has professional grade construction for lasting durability.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER






The best portable dolly for every photographer

The Dolica LT-D100 is the perfect dolly that enables smooth roll movement for every camera or video project. The dolly is compatible with all standard to professional tripods and light stands. When clamped properly onto absolutely any tripod you will feel how snug the tripod attaches to the dolly as it’s stable as the legs itself. When you’re ready to pack up, pull the locking pins, fold it up, and use the dolly handle or the carry case it comes with to move it from place to place.

This dolly is perfect for all standard to professional tripods, and light stands that enable a smooth roll movement





FEATURES
 * lighweight aluminum for easy mobility
 * single leg section to increase structural stability
 * adjustable clamps to lock in most tripods
 * fast action foot operated brakes
 * locking pull pins to fold or open dolly
 * dolly handle 
 * includes a black nylon case
   
   

SPECIFICATIONS
 * construction: rubber and aluminum alloy
 * doorway width: 31 inches (78cm)
 * folded height: 21.3 inches (54cm)
 * net weight: 4.5 lbs
 * wheel diameter: 76mm
 * wheel lock: yes

WARRANTY
 * 1 year warranty
feature_bullets: Fluid motion perfect for video cameras
Adjustable to fit almost any tripod
